alert.note: Alert for Coffey (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:29PM CDT until July 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN COFFEY COUNTY... At 927 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Burlington, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 925 PM CDT, a spotter estimated winds of 70 MPH 1 mile west of New Strawn. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Burlington, New Strawn, Gridley, Le Roy and John Redmond Reservoir. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing wind damage across Coffey County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
